news.title: House votes to override Trump's Canada tariffs
news.summary: Republican House leaders tried, and failed, to pass a measure on Tuesday. The measure would have blocked House disapproval votes on Trump tariffs through July.

news.title: Tech IPO hype gets drowned out on Wall Street by prospect of $1 trillion in debt sales
news.summary: SpaceX's potential IPO has generated plenty of investor buzz, but all of the real action in tech capital markets is currently on the debt side.

news.title: American Airlines flight attendants picket as CEO tries to calm frustrated employees
news.summary: The union that represents American's 28,000 cabin crew members issued a vote of no confidence of CEO Robert Isom. Isom is the CEO of American Airlines, which has a fleet of more than 100 aircraft.

news.title: Restaurant Brands earnings top estimates as international Burger King restaurants fuel sales growth
news.summary: Restaurant Brands' same-store sales climbed 6.1%. Outside of the U.S. and Canada, Restaurant Brands' sales rose 6.2%.

news.title: Why Alphabet’s 100-year sterling bond is raising new fears over debt-fuelled AI arms race
news.summary: The novel ultra-long corporate bond diversifies the Google owner's lender base as it ramps up its capex spend. The bond is expected to be issued by the end of the year.

news.title: ‘I’m not made of money’: My heating engineer didn’t fix my radiators on his first visit. Do I pay him a second time?
news.summary: "He charged $180 for the second visit for his time, including $40 for the part," the victim's attorney says. "It was a lot of money," the attorney adds. "He's a good guy. He's not a bad person"

news.title: It’s still a ‘low fire’ jobs market. Jobless claims stay low and unemployment falls early in the new year.
news.summary: Businesses aren’t hiring much, but they’re not resorting to big layoffs, either. Businesses aren't hiring much but aren't resorting in big layoffs either. The U.S. economy is in a hiring slump.

news.title: Crocs shoes are in high demand — in international markets, if not in North America
news.summary: Crocs’s overall sales fell, but beat expectations by a wide margin. Strength in the Crocs brand and internationally offset HeyDude weakness.

news.title: The latest jobs report is bad news if you’re looking for work — except in these fields
news.summary: January’s jobs report easily surpassed Wall Street expectations, giving a temporary boost to stocks. But it was downbeat data for many Americans who are unemployed and looking for work.

news.title: The smartest AI trade right now is in molecules and powders, says the research firm known for nailing trends early
news.summary: Citrini Research says dig deep into the molecules that both AI and traditional industries need and stop focusing on software. Citrini says the molecules need to be developed in a way that can be applied to a variety of industries.
